title: Kidmuri temple (Kalhu)
description: When Kalhu (biblical Calah, modern Nimrud) became the principal administrative center of the Assyrian Empire in the ninth century BC, king Ashurnasirpal II (r. 883–859 BC) built (or rebuilt) numerous temples. One of those was dedicated to the divine Kidmuri (probably a collective name for a group of gods).

properties.description: The representative location of the Kidmuri temple at Kalhu is based on the visible remains of the (partially) excavated Šarrat-niphi temple and those of the Northwest palace. The nineteenth-century excavation pit can no longer be seen today from satellite imagery.
properties.title: Representative location of the Kidmuri temple
